item.title: Bart add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Bart add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "I object to being told that I am saving daylight when my reason tells me that I am doing nothing of the kind... At the back of the Daylight Saving scheme, I detect the bony, blue-fingered hand of Puritanism, eager to push people into bed earlier, and get them up earlier, to make them healthy, wealthy, and wise in spite of themselves." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Bart add a quote by paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's
item.description: "Sure, 90% of science fiction is crud. That's because 90% of everything is crud." -- paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's
